required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the FluidVisionTM AIOL With an Improved Injector
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the FluidVision™ Accommodating Intraocular Lens With an Improved Injector System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the clinical outcomes of investigational FluidVision® Accommodating Intraocular Lens (AIOL) designed to provide distance, intermediate, and near vision in patients undergoing cataract extraction and intraocular lens implantation using an improved injector system.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was designed and conducted by PowerVision, Inc. Alcon Research, LLC, acquired PowerVision, Inc., in 2019.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective accommodative amplitude (calculated at the IOL plane)
primary_outcome.description: Accommodative amplitude is a measure of the ability of the eye to focus from a target that is at distance into a target that is near with good visual acuity. Objective accommodation (at the IOL plane) will be assessed using data generated by a photorefractor that analyzes the change in the refractive state of the eye.

primary_outcome.measure: Best corrected distance visual acuity (BCDVA) of logMAR of 0.3 or better
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity of the eye will be tested while reading charts at 20-foot equivalent distance from the participant with the correction obtained from manifest refraction testing.
Adverse events will be collected from time of enrollment to study exit

arm_group.arm_group_label: FluidVision AIOL with an improved injector system
arm_group.description: FluidVision AIOL implanted in the capsular bag following removal of the cataractous lens

intervention.intervention_name: FluidVision AIOL with an improved injector system
intervention.description: Accommodating intraocular lens designed to restore visual function at all distances using the eye's natural accommodative forces, intended for lifetime use
intervention.arm_group_label: FluidVision AIOL with an improved injector system

overall_official.last_name: Sr. Clinical Trial Lead, CDMA Surgical
